title: How to Make Golden Syrup Pudding With Self Raising Flour

steps.headline: Beat the butter and sugar together in a mixing bowl.
Add the eggs, beating in with a little of the flour to stop curdling.
Pour in the vanilla.
steps.description: Add the remaining flour and mix through.

steps.headline: Add a little milk to moisten the mixture.
steps.description: The resulting texture should be slightly dripping in consistency when allowed to drop from the spoon.

steps.headline: Grease the pudding basin using the butter.
steps.description: Pour the golden syrup over the base of the pudding basin.

steps.headline: Pour in the pudding mixture, on top of the syrup.
Butter some greaseproof paper.
steps.description: Place this over the top of the basin and hold in place with a layer of kitchen foil. Put a rack into a saucepan.

steps.headline: Place the saucepan on the rack.
steps.description: Have water reaching two-thirds of the way up the side of the pudding basin in the saucepan. Cover the saucepan.

steps.headline: Heat the water until simmering.
steps.description: Leave the pudding to steam for 1 1/2 hours. While it is steaming, check the water regularly and top up if needed.

steps.headline: Removed from the heat.
steps.description: Tip onto a serving plate and serve immediately. This goes well with custard or additional golden syrup.

text: Beat the butter and sugar together in a mixing bowl. Beat until creamy. Add the eggs, beating in with a little of the flour to stop curdling.  Pour in the vanilla. Add the remaining flour and mix through. Add a little milk to moisten the mixture. The resulting texture should be slightly dripping in consistency when allowed to drop from the spoon. Grease the pudding basin using the butter. Pour the golden syrup over the base of the pudding basin. Pour in the pudding mixture, on top of the syrup. Smooth over the top. Butter some greaseproof paper. Place this over the top of the basin and hold in place with a layer of kitchen foil. Put a rack into a saucepan. Place the saucepan on the rack. Have water reaching two-thirds of the way up the side of the pudding basin in the saucepan. Cover the saucepan. Heat the water until simmering. Leave the pudding to steam for 1 1/2 hours. While it is steaming, check the water regularly and top up if needed. Removed from the heat. Tip onto a serving plate and serve immediately. This goes well with custard or additional golden syrup.
